title: Moroccan Couscous with Seven Vegetables
description: The national dish of Morocco - fluffy steamed couscous served with a rich vegetable and meat stew, traditionally prepared on Fridays.

ingredients.item: Lamb or beef, cut into chunks
Carrots, peeled and cut into chunks
Pumpkin or squash, cut into chunks
Fresh cilantro, tied in a bundle
Fresh parsley, tied in a bundle

instructions: Soak saffron in 1/4 cup warm water. Drain soaked chickpeas.
In the base of a couscoussier or large pot, heat olive oil. Brown meat on all sides.
Add onions and cook until soft. Add grated tomatoes, tomato paste, and all spices (ginger, turmeric, saffron water, pepper, 1 tbsp salt). Cook for 5 minutes.
Add 2.5L water, cilantro and parsley bundles, and bring to boil. Skim foam, then reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes.
Add chickpeas and hard vegetables (carrots, turnips). Simmer for 30 minutes.

Meanwhile, prepare couscous: Place dry couscous in a large bowl. Mix 1 tbsp salt with 500ml warm water and gradually sprinkle over couscous, tossing with fingers to distribute evenly. Let rest 10 minutes.
Add remaining vegetables (zucchini, cabbage, pumpkin) to stew. Cook for 15 minutes.
Place couscous in top of couscoussier over simmering stew. Steam for 15 minutes.
Remove couscous to large bowl. Break up lumps with fork or hands. Sprinkle with 250ml cold water and 50g butter, working with fingers to separate grains.
Return couscous to steamer and steam for another 15 minutes over the stew.
Remove herbs bundles from stew. Adjust seasoning of broth.
To serve: Mound couscous on large platter, making a well in center. Arrange meat and vegetables over and around couscous.
Moisten with some broth and dot with remaining butter. Serve remaining broth and harissa separately for individuals to add to taste.
